title: F1 Racing Gets More Famous Friends
summary: Formula 1 racing is a fast car sport that has always been glamorous, but now it is becoming even more popular with celebrities. Susie Wolff, who knows a lot about F1, says the paddock area at races is like a catwalk where famous people show up. This change started when a company called Liberty Media bought F1 in 2017 and made it more modern. They stopped using grid girls and made a Netflix show called Drive to Survive, which shows behind-the-scenes drama and has brought in many new young fans. Celebrities like Beyoncé and Jennifer Lopez now go to races, making F1 a hot ticket. The sport is not just about racing anymore; it is also about the fun and excitement off the track.

background_read: Formula 1 (F1) is a car racing sport where drivers compete in fast cars around tracks worldwide. It has been around for over 70 years and is known for speed and luxury. Recently, it has become more popular with young people and celebrities because of shows like Drive to Survive on Netflix, which shows the drama behind the scenes. Companies like Liberty Media have helped make F1 more modern by using digital media and marketing to attract new fans.
